thread.title: Alan Pardew's chances of returning to management with Norwich City are fading
thread.title_full: Alan Pardew's chances of returning to management with Norwich City are fading

author: James Nursey
title: Alan Pardew's chances of returning to management with Norwich City are fading
text:
Sport Alan Pardew's chances of returning to management with Norwich City are fading The former Palace boss was installed as the initial favourite for the Carrow Road vacancy after Alex Neil was sacked a week ago Share Alan Pardew is keen to return to management after being sacked by Palace in December (Photo: Dan Mullan) Share Get football updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Alan Pardew is eager to return to management after sampling the Old Firm atmosphere but his hopes of landing the Norwich job are fading. 
Pardew, 55, attended Sunday's Glasgow derby as a guest of Celtic manager Brendan Rodgers after losing his job at Crystal Palace in December. 
MirrorSport understands Pardew told pals the atmosphere in the 1–1 draw at Celtic Park was “electric”. 
The former Palace, Newcastle and West Ham manager is keen to return to football. Pardiola enjoyed attending the Old Firm Derby (Photo: SNS Group) Pardew told pals the atmosphere at Celtic Park was “electric” (Photo: REUTERS) 
He was installed as the initial favourite for the Carrow Road vacancy at Championship Norwich after Alex Neil was sacked a week ago. 
He is keen on the job but has still heard nothing from Norwich who are believed to be hoping former England boss Roy Hodgson may take the post if he fails to get a Premier League job. poll loading Have Norwich made the right decision to sack Alex Neil? 0+ VOTES SO FAR
